did.unittitle: Lyndon A. Haight Collection of the Central New England Railway

repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: The collection consists of photocopies of timetables, maps, posters, correspondence and historical writings about the Central New England Railway, gathered by Lyndon A. Haight as research materials.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Lyndon A. Haight was born in Pine Plains, New York, and went to Syracuse University. In later life he lived in Auburn, New York and prior to his retirement was the treasurer of the Beacon Milling Company of Cayuga, New York. Mr. Haight was the author of Pine Plains and the Railroads (Pine Plains, NY: Little Nine Partners Historical Society, 1976). He had an avid interest in the railroads of New York State, particularly the Central New England Railway.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of photocopies of timetables, maps, posters, correspondence and other historical materials associated with the Central New England Railway and its predecessor railroad lines.

acqinfo.head: Provenance and Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated in June 2000 by the Central New York Chapter of the National Railway Historical Society.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to the railroads of southern New England. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the Reading Room desk.
